serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Area of Service
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute specifies the area where the terminals can access a particular network slice. Therefore, the attribute specifies the list of the countries where the service will be provided. The list is specific to NSPs and their roaming agreements

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Area of Service: Region specification
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: For every single country listed in the area of service attribute it needs to be indicated if the service will be provided in the whole country or just in part of the country. If the NSC requires a specific location, this attribute can be used to specify the regions of the country where the service will be provided. It needs to be completed for every country listed in the Area of service attribute. The list of regions is specific for each country and the way to define these regions is the decision of the NSC and NSP.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Delay tolerance
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Provide the NSC with service delivery flexibility, especially for the vertical services that are not chasing a high system performance. For instance, the service will be delivered once the mobile system has sufficient resources or during the off-peak hours. For this type of traffic, it is not too critical how long it takes to deliver the amount of data, e.g. within hours, days, weeks, etc.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deterministic communication
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute defines if the network slice supports deterministic communication for.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deterministic communication: Availabilty
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Availability describes if the network slice supports deterministic communication.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deterministic communication: Periodicity
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Periodicity provides a list of periodicities supported by the network slice.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: This parameter is present when the “Availability” is set to 1.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Downlink throughput per network slice
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The achievable data rate in downlink for the whole network slice (and not per user).

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Downlink throughput per network slice: Guaranteed downlink throughput
Downlink throughput per network slice: Maximum downlink throughput

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Downlink throughput per network slice: Guaranteed downlink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice in downlink.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Downlink throughput per network slice: Maximum downlink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute defines the maximum data rate supported by the network slice in downlink.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either maximum downlink throughput per network slice or Maximum downlink throughput per UE shall be present

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Downlink throughput per UE: Guaranteed downlink throughput
Downlink throughput per UE: Maximum downlink throughput

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Downlink throughput per UE: Guaranteed downlink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE (User Equipment) in downlink, which is required to achieve a sufficient quality experience (dependent on the selected service type) and can be seen as a guaranteed throughput. If the value is 0, best effort traffic is expected where no minimum throughput is guaranteed.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Attribute must be present if service is supported requiring guaranteed downlink throughput

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Downlink throughput per UE: Maximum downlink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum data rate supported by the network slice per UE in downlink. These parameters could be used to offer different contract qualities like gold, silver and bronze.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either maximum downlink throughput per network slice or Maximum downlink throughput per UE shall be present

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Energy efficiency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the energy efficiency of the network slice, i.e. the ratio between the performance indicator, in terms of data volume (DV), and the energy consumption (EC) when assessed during the same time frame. The energy efficiency is evaluated only when the network is running.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Energy efficiency: Network slice energy efficiency
Energy efficiency: Time frame of the measurement

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Energy efficiency: Network slice energy efficiency
Energy efficiency: Time frame of the measurement
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The time frame of the measurement shall be one of the alternatives: Weekly measurement: equals to 7 days. Monthly measurement: equals to 30 days. Yearly measurement: equals to 365 days.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: This parameter shall be present if Network slice energy efficiency is used.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Group communication support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes which type of group communication is provided by the network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation level: Isolation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Isolation is one of the key expectations of network slicing. A network slice instance may be fully or partly, logically and/or physically, isolated from another network slice instance.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation level: Physical Isolation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Physical network slices are physically separated (e.g. different rack, different hardware, different location, etc.). Process and threads isolation,  Physical memory isolation, Physical network isolation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: This parameter must be present when Isolation is set to 1.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Isolation level: Logical Isolation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Logical network slices are logically separated. Virtual resources isolation a network slice has access to specific range of resources that do not overlap with other network slices (e.g. VM isolation). Network functions isolation   NF (Network Function) is dedicated to the NSC, but virtual resources are shared. Tenant/Service Isolation  NSC data are isolated from other NSCs, but virtual resources and NFs are shared

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Location based message delivery
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the delivery of information in a particular geographic region.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Maximum supported packet size
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum packet size supported by the network slice and may be important for URLLC (Ultra-Reliable Low Latency Communication) and MIoT (Massive IoT), or to indicate a supported maximum transmission unit (MTU).

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Mission critical support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Mission-critical (MC) leads to a priority of the network slice relative to others, for C-plane (Control Plane) and U-plane (User Plane) decisions. This is relative to a customer provider relationship and to a PLMN (Public land Mobile Network)

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Mission critical support: Mission-critical capability support
Mission critical support: Mission-critical service support

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Mission critical support: Mission-critical capability support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Mission-critical (MC) leads to a priority of the network slice relative to others, for C-plane (Control Plane) and U-plane (User Plane) decisions. This is relative to a customer provider relationship and to a PLMN (Public land Mobile Network)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Conditional: Specifies capabilities  available to support mission-critical services. More than one capability may be supported at once. This parameter is optional when Mission critical support is set to 1 (mission-critical slice)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Mission critical support: Mission-critical service support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute specifies whether or not the network slice supports mission-critical push-to-talk (MCPTT), mission-critical data (MCData)], mission-critical video (MCVideo), Isolated E-UTRAN Operation for Public Safety (IOPS), or mission-critical interworking
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: This attribute must be present when Mission critical support is set to 1.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: MMTel support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes whether the network slice supports IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) and Multimedia Telephony Service MMTel. This parameter describes whether the GSMA PRD IR.92 0 compliant MMTel deployment is supported in the network slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: NB-IoT support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes whether NB-IoTis supported in the network slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Network Slice Customer network functions
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: A NSC can own some Network Functions (e.g. User Plane Function (UPF), User Data Management, UDM). This attribute provides a list of network functions to be provided by the NSC. If the list is empty, the NSC is not expected to provide any network function relevant for the network slice instance

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Number of connections
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of concurrent sessions supported by the network slice
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either Number of connections or Number of terminals shall be present

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Number of terminals
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of terminals supported by the network slice
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either Number of connections or Number of terminals shall be present

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance monitoring
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute provides the capability for NSC and NOP to monitor Key Quality Indicators (KQIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). KQIs reflect the end-to-end service performance and quality while KPIs reflect the performance of the network

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance monitoring: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter contains a list of KQIs and KPIs available for monitoring. If the list is empty this attribute is not available in the network slice and the other parameters might be ignored

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance monitoring: Monitoring sample frequency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes how often the KQIs and KPIs are monitored.

value.alias: conditional, e.g. in case a defined threshold is crossed

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance prediction
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute defines the capability to allow the mobile system to predict the network and service status. Predictive QoS (Quality of Service) can be done for various Key Quality Indicators (KQIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). KQIs reflect the end-to-end service performance and quality, while KPIs reflect the performance of the network. The prediction is done for a specific point of time in the future and for a specific geolocation.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance prediction: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter contains a list of KQIs and KPIs available for prediction. If the list is empty, the attribute is not available in the network slice and the other parameters might be ignored

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Performance prediction: Prediction frequency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes how often KQIs and KPIs prediction values are provided

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes if the network slice provides geo-localization methods or supporting methods.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning support: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes if this attribute is provided by the network slice and contains a list of positioning methods provided by the slice. If the list is empty this attribute is not available in the network slice and the other parameters might be ignored

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning support: Prediction frequency
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes how often location information is provided. This parameter simply defines how often the customer is allowed to request location information. This is not related to the time it takes to determine the location, which is a characteristic of the positioning method.

value.alias: conditional, e.g. in case a specific area is entered or left

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Positioning support: Accuracy
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes the accuracy of the location information. Accuracy depends on the respective positioning solution applied in the network slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Radio spectrum
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Defines the radio spectrum supported by the network slice. This is important information, as some terminals might be restricted in terms of frequencies to be used.

value.alias: UL: 1920 MHz – 1980 MHz DL: 2110 MHz – 2170 MHz FDD
UL: 3300 MHz – 4200 MHz DL: 3300 MHz – 4200 MHz TDD
UL: 3300 MHz – 3800 MHz DL: 3300 MHz – 3800 MHz TDD
UL: 4400 MHz – 5000 MHz DL: 4400 MHz – 5000 MHz TDD

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Root cause investigation
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Root cause investigation is the capability provided to NSC to understand or investigate the root cause of network service performance degradation or failure

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Session and Service Continuity support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The attribute defines the continuity of a Protocol Data Unit (PDU) session. The following three Session and Service Continuity (SSC) modes are specified: SSC mode 1 - the network preserves the connectivity service provided to the UE (the IP address is preserved), SSC mode 2 - the network may release the connectivity service delivered to the UE and release the corresponding PDU Session (the network may release IP address(es) that had been allocated to the UE), SSC mode 3 - changes to the user plane can be visible to the UE, while the network ensures that the UE suffers no loss of connectivity service (the IP address is not preserved in this mode when the PDU Session Anchor changes), None – UE loses the connectivity service

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Simultaneous use of the network slice
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes whether a network slice can be simultaneously with other network slice and if so, which group the network slice belongs to

value.alias: Can be used with any slice
Can be used with slices with same SST value
Can be used with any slice with same SD value
Cannot be used with another slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: some of these parameters 3GPP has already defined standard values [1]. By preselecting a 5G QoS Identifier (5QI) these parameters will automatically be filled out with the standardised values

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Resource Type
Slice quality of service parameters: Resource Type
Slice quality of service parameters: Priority Level
Slice quality of service parameters: Packet Delay Budget
Slice quality of service parameters: Packet Error Rate
Slice quality of service parameters: Jitter
Slice quality of service parameters: Maximum Packet Loss Rate

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: 3GPP 5QI
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: A 5QI is a scalar used as a reference to 5G QoS characteristics defined in clause [1], i.e. access node-specific parameters that control QoS forwarding treatment for the QoS Flow (e.g. scheduling weights, admission thresholds, queue management thresholds, link layer protocol configuration, etc.). 3GPP has already defined standardized 5QI to QoS characteristics mapping. See 5QI value in the table of GNST

value.alias: Real Time Gaming, V2X messages Electricity distribution – medium voltage, Process automation - monitoring
Video (Buffered Streaming) TCP-based (e.g., www, email, chat, ftp, p2p file sharing, progressive video, etc.)
Video (Buffered Streaming) TCP-based (e.g., www, email, chat, ftp, p2p file sharing, progressive video, etc.)
Video (Buffered Streaming) TCP-based (e.g., www, email, chat, ftp, p2p file sharing, progressive video, etc.)
Mission Critical user plane Push To Talk voice (e.g., MCPTT)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Resource Type
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The Resource Type determines if dedicated network resources related QoS Flow-level Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate (GFBR) value are permanently allocated [1]. This value needs to be provided for each customised 5QI value selected.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Priority Level
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The Priority level associated with 5G QoS characteristics indicates a priority in scheduling resources among QoS Flows. The Priority level shall be used to differentiate between QoS Flows of the same UE, and it shall also be used to differentiate between QoS Flows from different UEs. Once all QoS requirements up to GFBR are fulfilled for all the Guaranteed Bit Rate (GBR) QoS Flows, the Priority Level may also be used to distribute resources between GBR QoS Flows (for rates above GFBR up to MFBR, Maximum Flow Bit Rate) and non- GBR QoS Flows, in an implementation specific manner. The lowest Priority level value corresponds to the highest Priority [1]. This value needs to be provided for each customised 5QI value selected..

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Packet Delay Budget
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The Packet Delay Budget (PDB) defines an upper bound for the time that a packet may be delayed between the UE and the UPF, that terminates the N6 interface. For a certain 5QI the value of the PDB is the same in UL (Uplink) and DL (Downlink). In the case of 3GPP access, the PDB is used to support the configuration of scheduling and link layer functions (e.g. the setting of scheduling priority weights and HARQ (Hybrid Automatic Repeat request) target operating points).

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Packet Error Rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The Packet Error Rate (PER) defines an upper bound for the rate of PDUs (e.g. IP packets) that have been processed by the sender but that are not successfully delivered by the corresponding receiver. The purpose of the PER is to allow for the appropriate link layer, protocol configurations (e.g. RLC and HARQ in RAN of a 3GPP access). For all 5QIs the value of the PER is the same in UL and DL. For GBR QoS Flows with Delay critical GBR resource type, a packet which is delayed more than PDB (but which complies with the GFBR and MDBV (Maximum Data Burst Volume) requirements) is counted as lost, and included in the PER. This value needs to be provided for each customised 5QI value selected.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Jitter
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Jitter is defined as a variation in the delay of received packets. At the sending side, packets are sent in a continuous stream with the packets spaced evenly apart. Due to network congestion, improper queuing, or configuration errors, this steady stream can become lumpy, or the delay between each packet can vary instead of remaining constant.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Slice quality of service parameters: Maximum Packet Loss Rate
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The Maximum Packet Loss Rate (UL, DL) indicates the maximum rate for lost packets of the QoS flow that can be tolerated in the uplink (UL) and downlink (DL) direction.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Support for non-IP traffic
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute provides non-IP Session support (Ethernet session and forwarding support) of communication devices

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Supported device velocity
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Maximum speed supported by the network slice at which a defined QoS and seamless transfer between TRxPs (Transmission Reception Point(s)), which may belong to different deployment layers and/or radio access technologies (multi-layer /-RAT), can be achieved.

value.alias: High speed vehicular: 120 km/h to 500 km/h

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Synchronicity
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute provides synchronicity of communication devices. Two cases are most important in this context: Synchronicity between a base station and a mobile device and Synchronicity between mobile devices.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Synchronicity: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The synchronicity between devices over PC5 in absence of the network is not in scope of this attribute.

value.alias: between BS and UE & UE and UE

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Synchronicity: Accuracy
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes the accuracy of the synchronicity..

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Terminal density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum number of connected and/or accessible devices per unit area (per km2) supported by the network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Uplink throughput per network slice
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The achievable data rate of the network slice instance in uplink that is available ubiquitously across the coverage area of the network slice.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Uplink throughput per network slice: Guaranteed uplink throughput
Uplink throughput per network slice: Maximum uplink throughput

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Uplink throughput per network slice: Guaranteed uplink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice in uplink. There are services (e.g. emergency services) where guaranteed uplink throughput is required.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Uplink throughput per network slice: Maximum uplink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice in uplink. There are services (e.g. emergency services) where guaranteed uplink throughput is required.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either Maximum uplink throughput per network slice or Maximum uplink throughput per slice shall be present.

serviceSpecCharRelationship.name: Uplink throughput per UE: Guaranteed uplink throughput
Uplink throughput per UE: Maximum uplink throughput

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Uplink throughput per UE: Guaranteed uplink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the guaranteed data rate supported by the network slice per UE in uplink, required to achieve a sufficient quality experience (dependent on the selected service type). If the value is 0, best effort traffic is expected where no minimum throughput isguaranteed..

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Uplink throughput per UE: Maximum uplink throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the maximum data rate supported by the network slice per UE in uplink. These parameters could be used in order to offer different contract qualities like gold, silver and bronze.
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional: Either Maximum uplink throughput per network slice or Maximum uplink throughput per UE must be present

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User management openness
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This attribute describes the capability for the NSC to manage their users or groups of users’ network services and corresponding requirements. For instance, if NSC Y orders a network slice which is capable to support X users of Y, then Y should be capable to decide which X users could use this network slice. Hence, Y could manage the users, in terms of add, modify or delete users to receive network services provided by the specific network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User data access: Data access
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The attribute defines how the network slice (or mobile network) should handle the user data. The options are as follows: The device has access to the Internet,  All data traffic is routed to the private network (e.g. via tunnelling mechanism such as L2TP, VPN Virtual Private Network, tunnel, etc.), All data traffic stays local and the devices do not have access to the Internet or private network

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User data access: Tunnelling mechanism
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The attribute defines the tunnelling mechanism; how the user data can be delivered to the external private data network. 3GPP TS 29.561 [12] lists the interworking with data networks and tunnelling mechanism used
serviceSpecCharacteristic.regex: Conditional:This parameter is present if User data Access is 1(Termination in the private network).

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: V2X communication mode
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: This parameter describes if the V2X communication mode is supported by the network slice.
